availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Younger J. Thorp (Bracken County, KY, minister)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, minister. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Eliza Coghill Thorp in Carroll County, Kentucky, on October 6, 1852. Father of Johnson B. Thorp, William C. Thorp, Ann E. Thorp, and Mollie Thorp. Minister in Bracken County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, District 1, p. 255.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, Gratz, p. 152B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carroll County Marriages, Film 000414689, p. 417.
